attributes.action: look at regulating eBay Uk in regards their conduct towards sellers who use their website.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
The introduction of DSR are now being used to determine Top Rated Seller status. This system allows everyone to abuse it leaving reputable companies to suffer at the hands of rival companies. At which point, again the sellers hands are tied. 
There should be a time when these businesses have the legal right to ask for a detailed view of the DSR to be made available in order for issues to be corrected. eBay refuse point blank to provide this information when they encourage sellers frequently to contact buyers direct in regards to the change of unjustified feedback left.
All data produced on eBay in regards to individual seller activities and buyer submissions should be accessible by the seller.  
The feedback system shows clearly the reason for an increase or decrease of percentages so why should the DSR be private? Doubt is rising daily in regards to the legitimate scoring of DSR.
Equal rights for the sellers who are the foundation of eBay since it started should ideally be taken in to account. The buyer is fuelled with countless ammunition to obtain by the means of fraud or to ruin the reputation that has taken some businesses years to build.

rejection.details: The running of eBay is a matter for the parent company. If you would like to submit a more general petition we will be happy to look at it again.
reasons: Outside the remit of the Prime Minister and Government
